ETYMOLOGY: From Middle French lustre, from Italian lustro (meaning "lustre, splendor"), ultimately from Latin lustrare "to purify, brighten, illuminate."

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A gentle sheen or soft glow, especially that of a somewhat reflective surface.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 物体表面反射出的柔和光泽或微光。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The pearls had a beautiful luster.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这些珍珠有美丽的光泽。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A quality that makes something attractive or impressive; splendor or brilliance.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使某物具有吸引力或令人印象深刻的品质；光彩；魅力。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The controversy added luster to his career.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这场争议为他的事业增添了光彩。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A transitive verb, which is a verb that requires a direct object to complete its meaning.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To give a glossy or shiny finish to something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 给某物上光或使其有光泽。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They use a special glaze to luster the ceramic tiles.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们使用一种特殊的釉料来给瓷砖上光。
